item.title: Prudential PLC's Hong Kong-Boosted 1H Lifts Shares
item.description: Prudential shares rose to the top of the FTSE100 index after it posted first-half results slightly ahead of expectations and outlined its growth runway for the 2022-27 period.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Rise Amid Risks of Higher-Than-Expected Inflation Data
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields rose as markets see odds of higher-than-expected inflation in Spain and Germany, key data ahead of the ECB’s mid-September monetary policy meeting, Citi said.

item.title: Glynn's Take: Australia's Cooling Inflation Opens Door to Early 2024 Rate Cuts
item.description: Australia’s inflation readings continue to cool rapidly and should be shifting the conversation to a discussion about the timing of coming interest-rate cuts.

item.title: European Union New Car Sales Rise
item.description: Passenger-car registrations in the EU increased around 15% in July, with all major markets contributing to the overall growth as component shortages eased.

item.title: Orsted Faces Possible Hit on US Assets
item.description: Orsted said it may have to book impairments of up to $2.3 billion on its U.S. portfolio due to supply chain and tax credit issues and higher interest rates.

item.title: Ukrainian Drones Strike Deep Inside Russia, Hitting Military Airfield
item.description: As Kyiv disabled four Russian planes in a strike on the Pskov air base, Moscow launched a missile barrage on the Ukrainian capital.

item.title: Harmony Gold Meets Forecasts
item.description: Harmony Gold Mining reported fiscal 2023 earnings in line with its recent guidance, as it benefited from higher underground recovered grades and improved gold prices.

item.title: Prudential Profit Rises 6%
item.description: Prudential posted an above-forecast operating profit of $1.5 billion in the first half of 2023, helped by lower costs and higher asset-management profits.

item.title: EUR/USD Trade Is Volatile Due to Unclear Interest-Rate Outlook
item.description: Trading in EUR/USD has remained volatile, mainly due to the current lack of clear guidance from central banks on the interest-rate outlook, DZ Bank Research said.

item.title: CNN Expected to Tap Mark Thompson as CEO
item.description: The expected hiring of the former New York Times chief comes as the news network looks to reverse a multiyear ratings slump.

item.title: Why Many of China's College Grads Are Becoming 'Full-Time Children'
item.description: A record number of Chinese college students graduated this summer, but landing their dream job may be a long shot. WSJ takes a look at why China’s youth unemployment is at all-time highs.

item.title: U.S. Steel said it has entered into confidentiality agreements with "numerous third parties" and is starting to share due diligence information as it reviews bids for the company or parts of it.
item.description: U.S. Steel said it has entered into confidentiality agreements with “numerous third parties” and is starting to share due diligence information as it reviews bids for the company or parts of it.

item.title: Wagner chief Prigozhin was buried in St. Petersburg, his press service and state media reported, days on Tuesdayafter the jet he was on crashed in Russia, killing him and several top commanders of his paramilitary organization.
item.description: Wagner chief Prigozhin was buried in St. Petersburg, his press service and state media reported, days on Tuesdayafter the jet he was on crashed in Russia, killing him and several top commanders of his paramilitary organization.

item.title: Employers reported fewer open jobs last month, adding to signs that the solid labor market is gradually cooling in a higher-interest-rate environment.
item.description: Employers reported fewer open jobs last month, adding to signs that the solid labor market is gradually cooling in a higher-interest-rate environment.

item.title: Meta said it took down an online covert-influence operation aimed at advancing China's interests and discrediting its adversaries.
item.description: Meta said it took down an online covert-influence operation aimed at advancing China’s interests and discrediting its adversaries.

item.title: An appeals court ruled the SEC must reconsider crypto asset manager Grayscale's application to launch the first bitcoin ETF, the latest setback for Gensler's efforts to regulate the industry.
item.description: An appeals court ruled the SEC must reconsider crypto asset manager Grayscale’s application to launch the first bitcoin ETF, the latest setback for Gensler’s efforts to regulate the industry.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery is in advanced talks to name Mark Thompson, a former top executive of the New York Times and the BBC, as CNN's new leader.
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery is in advanced talks to name Mark Thompson, a former top executive of the New York Times and the BBC, as CNN’s new leader.

item.title: Major U.S. stock indexes rose for a third consecutive session, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow advancing 1.5%, 1.7% and 0.8%, respectively.
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes rose for a third consecutive session, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow advancing 1.5%, 1.7% and 0.8%, respectively.

item.title: A court in Pakistan suspended Imran Khan's three-year sentencein a corruption case, a legal victory that comes amid a continuing crackdown on the opposition leader and his political party.
item.description: A court in Pakistan suspended Imran Khan’s three-year sentence in a corruption case, a legal victory that comes amid a continuing crackdown on the opposition leader and his political party.

item.title: Air pollution is the world's top threat to public health, responsible for reducing average life expectancy by 2.3 years worldwide, a report by the University of Chicago's Energy Policy Institute concluded.
item.description: Air pollution is the world’s top threat to public health, responsible for reducing average life expectancy by 2.3 years worldwide, a report by the University of Chicago’s Energy Policy Institute concluded.
